Title: awesomeness!
Cons: none
Pros: awesome camera and awesome features

Title: Awesome camera
Cons:
Doesnt come with a cd cable... kodak wants $30 i just switched to my rechargable energizer

the video quality isnt what i would call HD mine seems to be a tad grainy
wasnt free
Pros:
Takes amazing quality pictures. any kodak camera i have owned have been able to take amazing photos.

I was looking at the nikon d60 but it was just out of my budget. then i found this one at sam's club and fell in love with it.
Comments: Found this for $209 at sams club but they want $60 for a 4gb sd card so purchase those here @ the egg

Title: Very Nice
Cons:
Video compression could be better, 1 minute of HD video is going to cost you 100 MB... O_O

Auto-mode can turn out some strange pictures every once in a while, so take two shots if it is important.
Pros: Looks good, easy to hold, nice form factor. Pictures look amazing if you take them right. The HD video 1280x720 is as good as some camcorders (with proper lighting).
Comments: All around a nice camera, and worth the money I'd say.

Title: Great Camera!
Cons: Battery life, sound quality on video
Pros: Great quality pictures, 12x zoom, electronic viewfinder, good click to capture time, feels solid and well-built, price.
Comments: This is a great camera for the price, takes great pictures, plenty of features. I cycle through my rechargables really fast though.  Just a warning, the case in the package deal is not nearly big enough to fit this camera in.

Title: In Love
Cons: got mine with an 8gb sdhc card. If you want to take videos, 16gb would be perfect for it fore hd 720p. An hd video 2 min 30 sec long took up 230MB. Wow!
Pros: This is a nice camera! takes wonderful pictures. what i like most is hd video on it. image stabilizer works like charm on videos.
Comments: Really hope my dog doesn't ever eat it

Title: Great camera!
Cons: Takes rechargeable batterys or a"lithium" cell.Not common things, i have 3 sets of 2500 NIMh AA cells (made by KODAK)and NONE will work on this. NO battery charge icon ONLY a"low battery" and on my camera it shuts off before the icon comes on.
Pros: WHeres do you start? I had a Z740 and like WOW this thing is like excellent. I takepictures of my kittys in action and only a few bad photos out of maybe 500 pictures. SO mant things to play with cmight take days to figure it all out. Excellent pictures, image stabilization, good burst and clear videos at all 3 settings. I use a 80x and a150X S/D cards and no stutter or slow problems in playback. FUn to use the"picture from video" feature, also can get a 9 up "action" print as well. PAnoramic is too fun,especially at the racetrack! BIG LCD back screen, and 5 settings for brightness, very clear as is the"viewfinder".
Comments: I have tried the"rechargeable" CRV-3 1500 mah baterys and works GREAT, also a 1900 Mah Lithium-ion and have taken 2x as many photos with the lithium cells. Check out rymes with OBOY for rechargeable batterys, can get a charged and SEt of batterys for what Kodak charges for 1 battery.

Title: Great Camera
Cons: Its face tracking is a bit poor. Some sony cameras will pick out 5 faces easily, this one struggles with one, but with straight on pictures can get two or three. Under anything but a straight on portrait it wont get the face recognition, however its default center focus function works fine anyways. The HD-Video  (720p) resolution lost sync with audio, i think its probably because my memory card isn't fast enough and i need a better one.
Pros: Optical Image Stabilizer makes this camera easy for anyone with the shakiest hands, A feature missing on the cheaper kodaks. Way better than a digital stabilizer. Beautiful Display, fast reaction times, great night shots, manual mode is easy and fun. Takes AMAZING videos with video optical zoom, and the stabilizer works during video mode too!
Comments:
The 640x680 video is smooth and the sound is great. It takes better video than my Sony Digital Handycam that I payed $500 for a few years ago.

For the price nothing can beat it. I can take over 300 pictures on one lithium CRV-3 Battery. I paid $50 more for mine, its a steal at this price.

Title: Great Camera For This Price Range
Cons: Not a Digital Single Lens Reflex camera, but they cost a lot more anyway.
Pros:
Good glass lens- excellent.
Manual controls available when desired.
Great pictures in Automatic mode.
Comments:
I actually own the older Z710 model.  They keep improving it, mainly by adding more megapixels.  Look for the 'Z' in the part number.  
This is an excellent camera to learn on while taking great prictures.  Later, if you want to, you can move up to a DSLR camera, but you will still want to keep this one.

Title: Best Digital Camera Value for a Professional Photography Student
Cons: No hot shoe (external flash attachment), Must buy a Rechargeable battery separately
Pros:
Excellent Price !!!
Superb Optical Zoom, Good Resolution, Simple and Intuitive Controls, SD Card Compatible(Most Used), HDTV Output, Lighter than Most regular SLRs, Excellent Battery Compatibility (AA), Image Stability is Good
Comments: This camera was a present to me but if I had to choose where to buy it, I would buy it at Newegg. The Price is the lowest I've seen!!!! Newegg Delivers it at Light speeds too!!!!

Title: Great Camera
Cons: none so far
Pros: Awesome zoom, image stabalize, high mega pixel
Comments: As soon as I got tis camera I started testing its limits. How good could the image stablize be..I took a picture of my 5 year old running, while shaking my hands hard and fast and she still came out crystal clear.  This camera has loads of options and I am looking forward to testing and experimenting with each of them.
